channel.title: Moparscape Eats a Hamburger
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jaf6zF-FJBk&feature=watch_response_rev
In the video, Andy Warhol eats a hamburger. Critics, linguists, psychs, and other artists from all over the world go to incredible footholds in order to express what exactly Warhol meant in this video. Warhol has said himself, that the video is completely pointless.
This brings me to thinking, there are infinite variables that rest in a final product, but no one ever truly knows the meaning behind it besides the artist themselves; artist being the creator. An artist should take hold of their work, as their own. They are not expecting any sort of particular response, unless the purpose of his/her work is to form a response. There are no true meanings behind anything at all, because it is whatever you make it.
This being said, this community is whatever you make it. There is, of course, the obvious premise of being a RSPS forum. But beyond the content, you contribute to this community with every post. You cannot control what other users mean in their posts, only your own. So when you think about the status of this community, perhaps view the depth of your own posts. You influence every critic in this community, and the critics are us.

B2300 T4nk:

Who is this ANdy guy? No troll.

are you a fucking retard?

item.title: Moparscape Eats a Hamburger
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Why do people bring topics like this here… Most of the community are 12-13 year olds.

If you want a real discussion, take it to the Discussion and Debates section over at MITB.

B2300 T4nk:

Who is this ANdy guy? No troll.[/quote][quote=“Tribbinator, post:5, topic:338387”]Andy Warhol is by no means a fool, look him up…And videos of people eating hamburgers is awesome.[/quote][quote=“spy man47, post:4, topic:338387”]Why would you show us a fool eating a humburger…?

See what I mean?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Eats a Hamburger
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

This video brings to mind the expression, “You are what you eat.” Like previously said, anything you do and how you act reflects on the community’s reputation (good or bad).

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Eats a Hamburger
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

If you both read what Reaper X said, this was a video, as Andy said, was pointless and means nothing. Yet, many people looked at it and came up with a ‘deep meaning’ of the video.

The point of this?
To show, that things are what you make of it, so saying thing like ‘Moparscape is shit’ is just contributing to everybody treating as so. Things are what you make of it, but the true meaning is in the artist himself.

This being said, this community is whatever you make it. There is, of course, the obvious premise of being a RSPS forum. But beyond the content, you contribute to this community with every post. You cannot control what other users mean in their posts, only your own. So when you think about the status of this community, perhaps view the depth of your own posts. You influence every critic in this community, and the critics are us.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Eats a Hamburger
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

As “there are infinite variables that rest in a final product”, a person does not primarily influence the mind of another who sure isn’t brainless. A person may successfully influence a person with higher respect and to quote Prof. Robert Cialdini, this response (people influenced by another of higher respect) makes great sense because legitimate authorities the reputable person have typically attained their positions by virtue of greater knowledge or skill or experience in the matter at hand.

If this thread ever got trolled, then I have nothing to say to the troll but to grow up.

Read full topic
